conference.name: ACM / IEEE 28th International Conference on Model Driven Engineering Languages and Systems

accepted.title: International Workshop on Collaborative and Participatory Modeling (CoPaMo 2025)
accepted.description: Collaborative modeling is a key enabler to engineering complex systems. While mostly focusing on the technical and technological aspects of collaboration, the MDE community has also recognized the need for more pronounced stakeholder-facing concerns in collaborative modeling techniques and tools.

accepted.title: 2nd International Workshop on Sustainability and Modeling (SusMod’25)
accepted.description: Sustainability is becoming a key characteristic of modern systems. This workshop aims to unearth visceral links between sustainability and MDE.

accepted.title: MDE Intelligence: 7th Workshop on Artificial Intelligence and Model-driven Engineering
accepted.description: This workshop aims to discuss how to choose, evaluate, and adapt AI techniques to MDE while improving current system and software modeling and generation processes.

accepted.title: Modeling Language Engineering (MLE)
accepted.description: The proposed MLE workshop aims at bringing together researchers and practitioners to discuss the challenges associated with the engineering of modeling languages.

accepted.title: MULTI 2025
accepted.description: The MULTI workshop series is the premier venue for researchers and practitioners working on multi-level modeling and multi-level software development.

accepted.title: Models and Evolution 2025 (ME 2025)
accepted.description: The ME workshop aims to bring together researchers and practitioners to discuss the latest developments around the evolution of models and various artifacts used in MDE.

accepted.title: Second International Workshop on Model Management (MoM)
accepted.description: The second edition of this MoM workshop aims to bring together international researchers and practitioners to improve the state-of-the-art in MoM and define future research directions.

accepted.title: LowCode 2025: Low-Code Development Platforms
accepted.description: The LowCode 2025 workshop aims to bring together vendors and users of low-code platforms with model-driven engineering researchers to explore collaboration opportunities.

accepted.title: MoDeVVa ’25: Model Driven Engineering, Verification and Validation
accepted.description: The workshop on Model Driven Engineering, Verification and Validation offers a forum for discussing emerging research in V&V approaches in MBSE/MDE.

accepted.title: onto:Nexus Ontological Modeling and Analysis Workshop
accepted.description: The goal of the workshop is to provide a presentation and discussion space for ontological modeling and analysis in the context of model-based software and systems engineering.

accepted.title: MoDIoT – 1st International Workshop on Model-Based Development for the IoT
accepted.description: The workshop aims to provide a platform for discussing the potential of model-based development in addressing the challenges of IoT.
